Show HN: Yboard is a multiplayer desktop-like workspace based on CRDT
text:
I've always been curious about real-time multiplayer user interfaces.

When I found out about CRDTs and Yjs[1] I thought they could serve as a solid base for a project like that.

So I built this pretty simple desktop-like UI (heavily inspired by lifeat.io) and used Yjs to replicate the whole UI state among multiple peers, creating the experience of a unique interface.

Try online: https://yboard.lol

[1]: https://github.com/yjs/yjs

title: Poll: Are You Skilled at Dev or Ops or a DevOps (Unicorn)?
text:
One comment inspired me to ask this pool. I'd like to know what is the distribution of unicorns between HN crowd.

> In my experience and opinion, developers are really bad at ops and sysadmins/ops are really bad a development. Anyone that is truly good at both is a unicorn that is probably carrying their team.

Websites Die
Ask HN: Bing blocking FOSS docs website, how do I find out why?
text:
I found out a few weeks ago that Bing has removed the documentation site for the open source project benthos (https://www.benthos.dev) from search results. I set up their webmaster tools and tried to get answers that way but all I get is a vague "URL cannot appear on Bing" answer, I then opened a support ticket and they still haven't answered after three weeks.

When I open a search (https://www.bing.com/search?q=benthos.dev) at the bottom there is a "Some results have been removed" link that lead me down a rabbit hole. There's a reports hub with some documents regarding site take downs but I can't find anything specific.

I'm not sure what I can do now other than wait and hope the support ticket eventually gets answered. If I could narrow it down to even just a copyright claim versus harmful content maybe I could work out where the problem is.
